Articles.Content:
Description:

This unorthodox looking beast of a plane has a high passenger capacity and is surprisingly agile and stable for its size. It's not technically hypersonic, still I would like to make one in the future that is.

Craft File:

https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B6PyqLj1ntwrN0JoM1BfQnFhdDQ

Craft Stats:

Parts: 180

Weight: 233.1 tonnes

Height: 10.5m

Width: 42.9m

Length: 47m

Video:

Edited November 6, 2015 by CaneSugar

Funny, I remembered a multi-fuselage from a science magazine almost thirty years ago when I saw the title, and then I saw your video ...

Good job! Repped!

Yes nice multi-fuselage build, I built this one where the Kerbals get a little different experience, although it's not near the size of yours!

Edited November 9, 2015 by castille7

Yes nice multi-fuselage build, I built this one where the Kerbals get a little different experience, although it's not near the size of yours!

Nice, I knew I wasn't the first to make a multi-fuselage plane, honestly it's the only obvious way to make planes this size in ksp without making the plane awkwardly long and floppy. I'm tempted to make one that holds a 1000 kerbals. My first multi-fuselage was a 56 kerbal SSTO:

(It obviously doesn't go much beyond low earth orbit )

I soon realized that a spaceplane wouldn't hold nearly as much kerbals as a normal plane because it would need to be 2/3th fuel in weight. It's also very challenging to keep it from stalling during descend because of the fuel imbalance, hence the big wings in the back to act like fletching on an arrow to keep the nose pointing in the right direction.

Edited November 9, 2015 by CaneSugar
I wouldn't want to pay the fuel bill on that one! ...lol. nice one!
